articles.headline: At Netflix, Victory for Voices Over Keystrokes
articles.snippet: Shunning low-cost call centers and e-mail-based service, Netflix is hoping to use customer service as a strategic weapon against Blockbuster’s rival DVD-mailing service.
articles.abstract: Shunning low-cost call centers and e-mail-based service, Netflix is hoping to use customer service as a strategic weapon against Blockbuster’s rival DVD-mailing service.
articles.lead_paragraph: HILLSBORO, Ore. — Megan Funk had been on the phone for 30 minutes and had already untangled one billing knot, listened to a woman insist that she had returned a Pilates DVD when it was clear she had lost it and received one request to replace a cracked copy of “Hotel Rwanda” and another to replace a disappointing husband.

articles.headline: China Plans Greater Scrutiny of Food Exports
articles.snippet: Chinese authorities said Wednesday that starting in September, all food shipments to the U.S. and other countries would be checked in the chain of production.
articles.abstract: Chinese authorities said Wednesday that starting in September, all food shipments to the U.S. and other countries would be checked in the chain of production.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 — Chinese government authorities are prepared to require that every shipment of food being exported to the United States and other countries be inspected for quality by the government, starting Sept. 1, a senior Chinese trade official said on Wednesday.

articles.headline: More Jitters Over Credit; Markets Fall
articles.snippet: The Dow Jones industrial average closed down 167.45 points after having stayed in positive territory for most of the day.
articles.abstract: The Dow Jones industrial average closed down 167.45 points after having stayed in positive territory for most of the day.
articles.lead_paragraph: Stocks fell sharply late yesterday afternoon, and one broad market index turned negative for the year as investors again questioned the economy’s ability to withstand financial shocks and higher borrowing costs.
articles.byline: By Vikas Bajaj and Jenny Anderson

articles.headline: Bluetooth and the End of Audio Wiring
articles.snippet: David Pogue delves into the disappearance of wires and the growing wireless technology industry.
articles.abstract: David Pogue delves into the disappearance of wires and the growing wireless technology industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: Here at the Pogue Purely Hypothetical High-Tech Mutual Fund, we recognize that although you can’t predict the future of technology, a few calls are easy to make. Right now, for example, there are certain industries we avoid investing in — like analog recording tape, landline telephone service and wires.

articles.headline: CARE Turns Down Federal Funds for Food Aid
articles.snippet: CARE, one of the world’s biggest charities, said that American food aid may hurt the people it aims to help.
articles.abstract: CARE, one of the world’s biggest charities, said that American food aid may hurt the people it aims to help.
articles.lead_paragraph: MALELA, Kenya — CARE, one of the world’s biggest charities, is walking away from some $45 million a year in federal financing, saying American food aid is not only plagued with inefficiencies, but also may hurt some of the very poor people it aims to help.

articles.headline: Virus Spreading Alarm and Pig Disease in China
articles.snippet: Virus experts say Chinese authorities are playing down the impact of the highly infectious virus — believed to be an unusually deadly form of an infection known as blue-ear pig disease.
articles.abstract: Virus experts say Chinese authorities are playing down the impact of the highly infectious virus — believed to be an unusually deadly form of an infection known as blue-ear pig disease.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHENGDU, China, Aug. 9 — A highly infectious swine virus is sweeping China’s pig population, driving up pork prices and creating fears of a global pandemic among domesticated pigs.

articles.headline: Bridge Failure Can’t Fend Off Usual Politics
articles.snippet: It took all of two weeks for the political unity brought on by a deadly bridge collapse in Minneapolis to unravel.
articles.abstract: It took all of two weeks for the political unity brought on by a deadly bridge collapse in Minneapolis to unravel.
articles.lead_paragraph: MINNEAPOLIS, Aug. 15 — It took all of two weeks for the political unity brought on by a deadly bridge collapse here to fall apart.
